beats.text_on_screen: Should You Race Big Sky Gravel?
beats.editing_note: STATE THE PREMISE IN 8 SECONDS. Clear value prop: 'I rated 328 races. Here's where this one lands.' This is the 8-second decision window. Viewers who stay past 15s are 58% more likely to finish.

beats.label: THE COURSE
beats.narration: Big Sky Gravel. Red Lodge, Montana. 70 mi. Montana mountain gravel.
beats.text_on_screen: Big Sky Gravel | Red Lodge, Montana | 70 mi
beats.editing_note: Let the course breathe. Show the route map, then cut to terrain-specific B-roll. This is the SETUP phase — grounding the viewer before the data analysis. Pacing: 25-40 sec cuts.

beats.label: THE SCORES — Top 8
beats.narration: Time to break down the scorecard. Length. 3 out of 5. Long enough to matter. Short enough to recover. Three distance options (22, 50, 100 miles) with staggered starts from 7:00 AM to 9:30 AM accommodate different capabilities well. Technicality. 3 out of 5. Requires line choice. Rewards the attentive rider. Course description promises "rolling hills and mostly smooth gravel roads" through Montana ranching country. Elevation. 3 out of 5. The hills sort the trained from the untrained. The 100-mile route delivers "over 6,000 ft in elevation gain along the foothills of the Beartooth mountains" with meaningful climbs including Virginia City. Altitude. 3 out of 5. Altitude starts to matter here. Red Lodge sits in Beartooth foothills with the race reaching elevations high enough to impact performance. Adventure. 3 out of 5. Adventure factor is real. "The Red Lodge and surrounding area is known for its immense landscapes connected by gravel roads in Carbon County. Value. 3 out of 5. Fair value. You get what you pay for. $70-$107 registration includes finish food, rider gift, swag bag, route nutrition, hydration, and SAG support - decent package for Montana pricing. Logistics. 2 out of 5. Functional. Not impressive. Downtown Red Lodge start/finish at Roosevelt Center works for lodging access, but packet pickup runs until 6:30 AM race morning suggests thin staffing. Climate. 2 out of 5. Weather cooperates more often than not. Historical weather data shows average highs of 77°F and lows of 55°F, with a 28% chance of rain on any given day.
beats.editing_note: PROGRESSIVE RHYTHM: start tight (15-20 sec per dimension), slow down for the most interesting scores (30-40 sec). Each score: number appears, brief pause, explanation. Avatar reacts to extreme scores (5/5 = chef_kiss, 1/5 = facepalm). RE-ENGAGEMENT at 3:00 mark: insert a surprising score reveal or a meme reaction to break the pattern.

beats.label: THE SCORES — Also Scored
beats.narration: The rest, in rapid succession. Race Quality. 2 out of 5. Basic but functional. Gets the job done. Experience. 2 out of 5. Pleasant enough. Won't change your life. Community. 2 out of 5. Riders acknowledge each other. Barely. Expenses. 2 out of 5. Expensive. Travel and lodging add up fast. Prestige. 1 out of 5. Nobody at the coffee shop will recognize this name. Field Depth. 1 out of 5. Not exactly stacked.
